page.title: 03WEST COMMON
page.content: The West Common is a large area of grass and trees which measures 3.5 miles round the edge. It is open for anyone to go on. There is a football pitch, rugby pitch, bowling green and tennis court. It slopes at the end so it is popular for sledging in the winter. There is a small pond called the Ornamental pond which has fish in. Sometimes there are point-to-point races with horses. Usually there are horses standing on the common. Down one side there is a small lane with trees on called Aldermans Walk, there are houses too. There are small places fenced in with small trees that have just been planted. If you stand at the bottom of the common you get a good view of the City and if you stand at the top you get a very good view of the countryside.
